meanings.definition: To turn into a commodity for sale
meanings.sent1: She was commodifying her handmade crafts to sell at the market.
meanings.sent2: The company was commodifying the natural resources for profit.
meanings.sent3: The idea of commodifying friendship seemed strange to him.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, everything can be commodified, even emotions.
meanings.sent5: The process of commodifying goods made them lose their personal touch.

meanings.sent1: He was commodifying his employees by valuing them solely for their productivity.
meanings.sent2: The artist felt uncomfortable commodifying her art for mass production.
meanings.sent3: Commodifying time as a resource can lead to a stressful lifestyle.
meanings.sent4: She realized she had been commodifying her relationships, neglecting their true value.
meanings.sent5: The practice of commodifying human labor dehumanizes individuals.

meanings.definition: To make something into a commodity
meanings.sent1: The company was commodifying the cultural heritage of the community.
meanings.sent2: Commodifying nature can have detrimental effects on the environment.
meanings.sent3: He joked about commodifying the air we breathe and selling it.
meanings.sent4: The trend of commodifying education can hinder the pursuit of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: By commodifying art, its intrinsic value is often overlooked.
